title: ESA preperation
content:
I scored 31 in my first isa and likely to score 25 in isa2 in Python.
Can anyone give tips to get 85+ for esa in python.
I am not understanding what study .

comments.body: Scored >38 in ISA 1. Use the notes and keep messing with your text editor while reading so you really understand what the content is saying.
had python in 11th and 12th, that's it
It is very much doable, so jus chill and go for it python esa's are really easy most of the times

Literally just notes.
Nothing ever comes from outside notes.
NOTES
and make sure to actually try to code in python
Anything in notes they can ask

focus on key topics and brush up on basics. Do mock tests ASAP!...
  if u stick to those, u'll definitely boost ur score
Was not the case in isa tho

It's probably Derived from a concept in notes.
But as of my knowledge, notes are more than enough
Do you mean self made notes or the ones on academy?
Where are the mock tests that's you're referring to?
Ask ur prof, theyâ€™ll def give u related Qs, but u gotta do some buttering lol or use LeetCode for practice tests.
